00037 #ifndef __OBD_CKSUM
00038 #define __OBD_CKSUM
00039 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00040 #include <libcfs/libcfs_crypto.h>
00041 #include <lustre/lustre_idl.h>
00042 
00043 static inline unsigned char cksum_obd2cfs(cksum_type_t cksum_type)
00044 {
00045         switch (cksum_type) {
00046         case OBD_CKSUM_CRC32:
00047                 return CFS_HASH_ALG_CRC32;
00048         case OBD_CKSUM_ADLER:
00049                 return CFS_HASH_ALG_ADLER32;
00050         case OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C:
00051                 return CFS_HASH_ALG_CRC32C;
00052         default:
00053                 CERROR("Unknown checksum type (%x)!!!\n", cksum_type);
00054                 LBUG();
00055         }
00056         return 0;
00057 }
00058 
00059 /* The OBD_FL_CKSUM_* flags is packed into 5 bits of o_flags, since there can
00060  * only be a single checksum type per RPC.
00061  *
00062  * The OBD_CHECKSUM_* type bits passed in ocd_cksum_types are a 32-bit bitmask
00063  * since they need to represent the full range of checksum algorithms that
00064  * both the client and server can understand.
00065  *
00066  * In case of an unsupported types/flags we fall back to ADLER
00067  * because that is supported by all clients since 1.8
00068  *
00069  * In case multiple algorithms are supported the best one is used. */
00070 static inline u32 cksum_type_pack(cksum_type_t cksum_type)
00071 {
00072         unsigned int    performance = 0, tmp;
00073         u32             flag = OBD_FL_CKSUM_ADLER;
00074 
00075         if (cksum_type & OBD_CKSUM_CRC32) {
00076                 tmp = cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32));
00077                 if (tmp > performance) {
00078                         performance = tmp;
00079                         flag = OBD_FL_CKSUM_CRC32;
00080                 }
00081         }
00082         if (cksum_type & OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C) {
00083                 tmp = cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C));
00084                 if (tmp > performance) {
00085                         performance = tmp;
00086                         flag = OBD_FL_CKSUM_CRC32C;
00087                 }
00088         }
00089         if (cksum_type & OBD_CKSUM_ADLER) {
00090                 tmp = cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_ADLER));
00091                 if (tmp > performance) {
00092                         performance = tmp;
00093                         flag = OBD_FL_CKSUM_ADLER;
00094                 }
00095         }
00096         if (unlikely(cksum_type && !(cksum_type & (OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C |
00097                                                    OBD_CKSUM_CRC32 |
00098                                                    OBD_CKSUM_ADLER))))
00099                 CWARN("unknown cksum type %x\n", cksum_type);
00100 
00101         return flag;
00102 }
00103 
00104 static inline cksum_type_t cksum_type_unpack(u32 o_flags)
00105 {
00106         switch (o_flags & OBD_FL_CKSUM_ALL) {
00107         case OBD_FL_CKSUM_CRC32C:
00108                 return OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C;
00109         case OBD_FL_CKSUM_CRC32:
00110                 return OBD_CKSUM_CRC32;
00111         default:
00112                 break;
00113         }
00114 
00115         return OBD_CKSUM_ADLER;
00116 }
00117 
00118 /* Return a bitmask of the checksum types supported on this system.
00119  * 1.8 supported ADLER it is base and not depend on hw
00120  * Client uses all available local algos
00121  */
00122 static inline cksum_type_t cksum_types_supported_client(void)
00123 {
00124         cksum_type_t ret = OBD_CKSUM_ADLER;
00125 
00126         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Crypto hash speed: crc %d, crc32c %d, adler %d\n",
00127                cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32)),
00128                cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C)),
00129                cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_ADLER)));
00130 
00131         if (cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C)) > 0)
00132                 ret |= OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C;
00133         if (cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32)) > 0)
00134                 ret |= OBD_CKSUM_CRC32;
00135 
00136         return ret;
00137 }
00138 
00139 /* Server uses algos that perform at 50% or better of the Adler */
00140 static inline cksum_type_t cksum_types_supported_server(void)
00141 {
00142         int          base_speed;
00143         cksum_type_t    ret = OBD_CKSUM_ADLER;
00144 
00145         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Crypto hash speed: crc %d, crc32c %d, adler %d\n",
00146                cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32)),
00147                cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C)),
00148                cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_ADLER)));
00149 
00150         base_speed = cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_ADLER)) / 2;
00151 
00152         if (cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C)) >=
00153             base_speed)
00154                 ret |= OBD_CKSUM_CRC32C;
00155         if (cfs_crypto_hash_speed(cksum_obd2cfs(OBD_CKSUM_CRC32)) >=
00156             base_speed)
00157                 ret |= OBD_CKSUM_CRC32;
00158 
00159         return ret;
00160 }
00161 
00162 
00163 /* Select the best checksum algorithm among those supplied in the cksum_types
00164  * input.
00165  *
00166  * Currently, calling cksum_type_pack() with a mask will return the fastest
00167  * checksum type due to its benchmarking at libcfs module load.
00168  * Caution is advised, however, since what is fastest on a single client may
00169  * not be the fastest or most efficient algorithm on the server.  */
00170 static inline cksum_type_t cksum_type_select(cksum_type_t cksum_types)
00171 {
00172         return cksum_type_unpack(cksum_type_pack(cksum_types));
00173 }
00174 
00175 /* Checksum algorithm names. Must be defined in the same order as the
00176  * OBD_CKSUM_* flags. */
00177 #define DECLARE_CKSUM_NAME char *cksum_name[] = {"crc32", "adler", "crc32c"}
00178 
00179 #endif /* __OBD_H */
